items.title: Michael Paul Young 2
items.piece_name: Where we were but no longer are.
items.artist_biography:
Michael Paul Young is a renowned digital designer, programmer and visionary. His project Designgraphik helped shape online design through the late 90s and early 00s, and earned him a Chrysler Design Award nomination at the age of 23. He founded YouWorkForThem in 2001 and now serves as Creative Director and owner. 

Michael’s innovative work has been exhibited worldwide. He’s won elite awards including a Clio and Cannes Gold Lion. He’s also a sought-after speaker. 

Michael lives with his wife and children in Bangkok, Thailand.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝Moving to this set from the first, I wanted to then provide another view into the same ‘space,’ but after some time has passed, during which efforts have been made to hide the events that happened. The ornamental elements act as stamps that have been placed by an outside force to hide the details, as if blind spots have grown in the retinas of the viewer, obscuring the complexity of what occurred.❞

items.title: Damien Mortini
items.artist_biography:
Damien Mortini is a Creative Technologist and Consultant. 

Studied and licensed in Paris, Damien has worked with TBWA, Digitas, Somewhat_ and UNIT9 before going freelance. Damien’s client list spans industries from Google and Microsoft to General Electric, Air France and Mercedes-Benz. Notable awards include Clios, Webbys and multiple Sites of the Day. 

Damien is currently based in Montréal, Québec.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝In a world where bits of us are swallowed little by little everyday in the digital metaverse. Tomorrow, what will it mean to be human? In Ballerina 3.0, I wanted to question our cognitive presence. While the elegant and fluid movements put in our brain the hipnotic image of a talented dancer, when everything get slower and the body parts are merging, the human fades to become something else, something we don't appreciate as much...❞

items.title: Gonzalo Miranda
items.artist_biography:
Gonzalo Miranda is an Art Director and 3D Artist creating at the inflection points of craft and digital innovation. 

With a deep sense of space, light and composition, Gonzolo specializes in product and interior visualization, as well as concept framing and animation styling. Gonzalo’s portfolio of clients includes Microsoft, Google, Oakley and Spotify, as well as studio partnerships with ManvsMachine, Tendril, The Mill and Hornet NYC.

Gonzalo currently resides in Madrid.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝'Table for two' depicts an abstract dinner night were the furnishing, plates, table clothing have been distorted into a sculptural shape.❞

items.title: Chris Hoffmann 1
items.artist_biography:
Chris Hoffmann loves to create worlds, big or small, with sound and vision that sucks you in, let’s you change your perspective or simply invites you for a nice swim in a warm puddle of escapism. 

Working heavily in design, sound and animation, Chris creates futuristic critters who live in alternate realities. He began his career at Parasol Island studio in Dusseldorf, worked at the Berlin studio Zeitguised, and is now a freelance digital artist. His clients include Apple, BMW, Chanel, IKEA, Kvadrat, Lexus and Microsoft.

Chris lives and works in Berlin.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝A running spirit that runs most of its life. While its running you can hear a little hum that is produced through wind passing through the hoops left and right of its body. This also lets other entities know that the runner is approaching so they can move out of the way as it is very dangerous to have a collision with them.❞

items.title: Danil Tabacari
items.artist_biography:
Danil Tabacari is a 3D Designer and Art Director. Inspired by architectural photography, fine art paintings, sculpture and industrial design, Danil’s curiosity pushes him to endlessly explore new themes, techniques and aesthetics. 

Working across industry and engagement, Danil has partnered with Microsoft, Tableau, Isla Instruments, Cool Machine Shop and Noodle AI, as well as agencies Britelite Immersive, &Walsh, Xitelabs and Publicis. His artist collaborations include Louis the Child, Bad Bunny and Kygo. 

Danil lives in the Republic of Chișinău, Moldova.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝Morning is a special time for dreaming. Starting a day with a walk eases me into a creative day. I enjoy my walks through the skatepark to the bridge to get to the other side of the lake. The Clouds were graphic that day. Enjoy bubble tea walking through a park to the beach. I like to sit on steps near water where the sun is reflecting in water. Listening to vaporwave music connects everything together, joyfull nostalgic mood.❞

items.title: Johana Kroft Dog
items.artist_biography:
Johana Kroft is a fine artist and NFT designer from the Czech Republic. Her vivid-yet-minimalistic style creates futuristic worlds in 2D and 3D via illustration and motion design videos. Inspired by travel and emotion, she describes her style as “elegant and poetic.”

Starting her career at DDB and Ogilvy Prague, Johanna then founded the London studio Idea & Maker. She’s the recipient of several notable features including Behance and Wacom Gallery, as well as winning a Cannes Young Lion for her work “Story in Seconds.”
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝Noise is presenting how it is to be stuck in the noisy circles of emotions and thinking.'❞

items.title: Florian Zumbrunn
items.artist_biography: Florian Zumbrunn is a Media Artist at the intersection of front-end technologies and human imagination. Blending art and innovation, Florian harnesses the power of technological capability to design and create immersive and evocative experiences. Through his career he worked in worldwide agencies, partnered with brands including Hublot, Google, Pharrell Williams and had some exhibitions in Paris, Tokyo and Milan. He also co-founded the media art studio Makio&Floz. Florian is currently based in Paris.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝'Subdivide and Regrow' is a generative piece, evolving through time. The multiple tiles of the scenes will subdivide, reaching a maximum division, and sometimes regrow. Following a certain set of rules, and being randomized, you could watch it infinitely and almost never see the same composition twice. It could be seen as a metaphor of life.❞

items.title: Christophe Zidler
items.artist_biography:
Christophe Zidler is a 3D artist and motion designer opening new worlds of possibility through cheerful and experimental creations. 

Over the course of his career, Christophe has partnered with global brands including Microsoft, Vogue and Toyota. He also shares his expertise via coursework, education and mentorship. In all he does, Christophe researches and incorporates elements that bring surprise and delight. 

Christophe lives in Paris.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝'Love by Robots' expresses a moment, a drop of time of the life of two digital avatars. We don't really know what they are, humans behind a machine, or robots themself. In a world that becomes less and less tangible every day, the most important remains the same, the emotions.❞

items.title: Benoit Challand
items.artist_biography:
Benoit Challand is a creative at the edge of art and design. He loves to create images, design mood, and work in digital and spacial realms using his favorite medium, 3D tool. 

Actively collaborating worldwide with brands, agencies and studios as an Art Director, Creative Director and Producer, Benoît’s clients include Apple, Adobe, Audi, Chanel, Guerlain, Jean-Paul Gaultier, Nissan and Louis Vuitton.

Benoit began his career in Paris, before moving to Madrid. He now lives in Lyon, France.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝The Popou Design Familly, a digital seating serie. The name Popou come from my grandfather surname and remind me the hearty moment shared with him. At the moment where we looking for comfort and freedom. This serie has been designed to suggest the share of an intimate moment.❞

items.title: Michael Paul Young
items.artist_biography:
Michael Paul Young is a renowned digital designer, programmer and visionary. His project Designgraphik helped shape online design through the late 90s and early 00s, and earned him a Chrysler Design Award nomination at the age of 23. He founded YouWorkForThem in 2001 and now serves as Creative Director and owner. 

Michael’s innovative work has been exhibited worldwide. He’s won elite awards including a Clio and Cannes Gold Lion. He’s also a sought-after speaker. 

Michael lives with his wife and children in Bangkok, Thailand.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝I knew I wanted to work deconstructively, so that led me to consider a vortex within a volumetric medium, as would be created by a propeller in water, or a turbine within air. I wanted to envision a moment in a ‘space’ in which a huge structure that was created by the vortex is beginning to crumble, as fragments begin to slowly fall out into the disrupted medium, until eventually there is nothing left.❞

items.title: Maxim Shkret
items.artist_biography:
Maxim Shkret is a digital sculptor advocating for experimentation at the intersection of digital and physical art. He believes imagination is free of constraints and boundaries, and innovation is an engine that fuels the creative process and takes aesthetics to new heights. 

Trained in classical art and industrial design, Maxim is pioneering a form of hard surface modeling and organic sculpting called “solid organics.” Still in its early days, the technique is created without the use of scripts or third-party plug-ins. 

Maxim is based in Saint Petersburg.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝Predominantly working in the animalistic genre, he is confident that only through biodiversity humanity can continue to understand itself within the scientific and spiritual domains.❞

items.title: Danil Tabacari 2
items.artist_biography:
Danil Tabacari is a 3D Designer and Art Director. Inspired by architectural photography, fine art paintings, sculpture and industrial design, Danil’s curiosity pushes him to endlessly explore new themes, techniques and aesthetics. 

Working across industry and engagement, Danil has partnered with Microsoft, Tableau, Isla Instruments, Cool Machine Shop and Noodle AI, as well as agencies Britelite Immersive, &Walsh, Xitelabs and Publicis. His artist collaborations include Louis the Child, Bad Bunny and Kygo. 

Danil lives in the Republic of Chișinău, Moldova.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝Being a 3D artist for me is a lifelong journey. A Wide variety of disciplines goes into each artwork. Composition, color, light, material, software skills just to name a few. I have a passion for deep, fundamental understanding on a topic. Some disciplines take a couple of years to learn through theory and practice. Hard work leads to moments of breakthrough in understanding, euphoria, exitment. Looking back on my path, it's unpredictable. And after each enlightenment, I see design in a new way.❞

items.title: Santi Zoraidez
items.artist_biography:
Santi Zoraidez is a passionate Art Director and Designer with a desire to transform ideas into striking art. His work combines digital and reality with a sense of space, colour, light and inventiveness that’s modern and fresh. 

His ability to merge expert illustration with groundbreaking digital effects has led Santi to work with companies at the forefront of creativity, including Apple, Nike and Ikea.

Santi was born in Argentina and spent years living and working in Copenhagen, Berlin and Buenos Aires before settling in Barcelona where he continues his practice.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝A colorful character transmitting good vibes! The pictured piece, was done on a day of good news.❞

items.title: Chris Hoffmann 2
items.artist_biography:
Chris Hoffmann loves to create worlds, big or small, with sound and vision that sucks you in, let’s you change your perspective or simply invites you for a nice swim in a warm puddle of escapism. 

Working heavily in design, sound and animation, Chris creates futuristic critters who live in alternate realities. He began his career at Parasol Island studio in Dusseldorf, worked at the Berlin studio Zeitguised, and is now a freelance digital artist. His clients include Apple, BMW, Chanel, IKEA, Kvadrat, Lexus and Microsoft.

Chris lives and works in Berlin.
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝This spirit is a announcer basically like a blog or a news site that announces news and changes in the world. It is rarely seen actually but you can hear it from miles away.❞

items.title: Johana Kroft
items.artist_biography:
Johana Kroft is a fine artist and NFT designer from the Czech Republic. Her vivid-yet-minimalistic style creates futuristic worlds in 2D and 3D via illustration and motion design videos. Inspired by travel and emotion, she describes her style as “elegant and poetic.”

Starting her career at DDB and Ogilvy Prague, Johanna then founded the London studio Idea & Maker. She’s the recipient of several notable features including Behance and Wacom Gallery, as well as winning a Cannes Young Lion for her work “Story in Seconds.”
items.behind_the_scene_text: ❝We all have more than one character inside of us. We are usually present just one better side. Two face just showcase how people are.❞
